{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 17 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We've recently received some commentary through other channels,  so I thought I would provide an update to reiterate our position on this issue.

JIRA's voting system was initially designed for cases where JIRA served as a public bug tracker or feature request management system, like [jira.atlassian.com|http://jira.atlassian.com] or [issues.apache.org/jira|http://issues.apache.org/jira].

As JIRA has matured, we have focused more and more on teams using JIRA for internal software development. Voting provides a useful way to capture quantitative feedback when your issues are public; however, it is not intended as a way for small development teams to prioritize their work.

*We recognize that everyone uses JIRA differently*, and that not having this feature makes it more difficult for teams to implement a strict prioritization-by-voting process with JIRA. However, *our current focus* is on improving the usability and performance for teams planning using components, versions, backlogs and boards. In short, additional functionality for voting is not a priority for us for the foreseeable future.

If you have any questions, please email me. dmeyer@atlassian.com

Thanks,
Dave Meyer
Prodct Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Currently, it is not possible for a reporter to vote for their own issue. It would be nice to allow reporters to vote for their issue - perhaps make this optional.

A use case would be:

"QA manager may log bugs but also be part of the committee that chooses bugs to be fixed via voting."
fields.summary: Allow reporters to vote

fields.description:
At the moment some users believe that field configurations and field screens are associated with each other. In our docs we need to make it clear that fhey are separate.

We probably need some sort of diagram like below:
     Issue Type Field Screen Scheme -> Issue Type -> Field Screen Scheme -> Field Screen
    /
Project
    \
     Field Configuration Scheme -> Issue Type -> Field Configuration
fields.summary: Update docs on field screens and field configurations

Is there a way to perform a search based on date/time of the latest transition without developing a plug-in? For example it would be useful to search for issues that were closed at a certain date, or for issues that were moved from one state to another within x number of days.
This would be feasable if *"Transition post function"* *"Update issue field"* worked on date/time fields. Then I would have created a custom field called *"Transition Time"* and had it set to current date/time automatically during all transitions which I could easily perform a search on. Is it possible to extend *"Update issue field"* functionality to include the date/time fields?

Thanks
Ahmet

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 15 November 2012|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue. 

First, my apologies for not having an update on this new feature request for such a long time.

We have discussed this feature at length, and as we have no plans to implement this feature in the foreseeable future, we are closing this issue. 

We have prioritized improving screen editing for the existing transition, create, edit, and view screens, rather than adding more screens that can be customized. (You can see a number of improvements in JIRA 5.2 with screen editing). We have received a large amount of feedback on the need for simplification of the current project configuration in JIRA including the current screen editor, and we are focused on making the existing capabilities of managing fields and screens easier for new and existing customers to manage.

Given the large number of votes and compelling comments, we did not make this decision lightly or without taking all your comments into consideration. The decision to close a highly voted feature request is never an easy one.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach, even when we do not plan to solve a highly voted feature request.

Cheers,

Bryan
JIRA Product Management
brollins at atlassian dot com

{panel}

*Original Description*
the user is JIRA-developer group which can have permission to schedule issue, check the assign issue screen that has due date with more other fileds. when assign an existed issue, only see 'Assign To', 'Update comment' and 'Comment viewable by', I don't see 'Due date'.
fields.summary: Cannot customize assign issue screen

fields.description:
Attempting to browse a project without being logged in causes a Java exception (full details in attachment). Logging in makes the problem go away.

Following a link from a page or e-mail (e.g., http://<server>/browse/<project>) or pasting the URL into the browser both repro the issue.

The issue repros on IE 6.0 and Firefox 1.5.
fields.summary: Attempting to browse a project without being logged in causes a Java exception

fields.description:
Quite often users cut and paste emails/other documents into an issue, and use the {{\{noformat\}}} option.

Depending on the formatting, this occassionally creates a very wide, annoying screen (particularly if users commit the comment without previewing it first!)  

 It would be nice if {{\{noformat\}}} came with a {{wrap}} option like the HTML {{<pre>}} tag.
fields.summary: Provide a wrap option with the noformat markup
Support browser text size in IE

fields.description:
If there are any required fields on a screen which are not filled or selected, when the transition button is clicked, the screen is refreshed with the required fields marked in pink and the comments are erased. Can this be fixed?
Thanks.
fields.summary: Comments lost during workflow transition

fields.description:
We upgraded to JIRA 3.4.2 from 3.1 and now I receive all of my email notifications twice: once as HTML and once as text. Interestingly nobody else was suffering from this problem. I then discovered that switching my notification scheme back to text meant that I only received the message once. While this is a tolerable solution, I much prefer receiving emails as HTML.

In case this is relevant, our setup has a group called Know-it-alls which in our notification scheme gets sent an email for every JIRA even. I am a member of the Know-it-alls group so that I can keep track on everything going on. So it is possible that this bug is somehow related to notification of groups rather than notification of individual users.
fields.summary: JIRA email notifications being sent twice

fields.description:
We have imported Issues from Bugzilla. The old id is linked in an import id custom field.
If we edit the Issue, Jira will add the changed info in the history field. Jira will also add a line about the importid even though it's not been changed.  And new value is empty
fields.summary: workhistory is allways updating import id

fields.description:
If a mail has a 'Precedence: bulk' header, it was automatically generated, and we probably don't want to create an issue / issue comment from it.

Implementing this would save us from occasional mail loops, as autoresponders (which generally set Precedence: bulk) generate JIRA comments, which generate mail, generating autoresponses, etc.
fields.summary: JIRA MailService should ignore emails with Precedence: bulk header

fields.description: Under workflow, transition, it is possible to define who is allowed to do this transactions by adding a condition to the transition. Would it also be possible to define the team that can be assigned to this issue in the new state.
fields.summary: Would it also be possible to define the team that can be assigned to this issue in the new state.

fields.description: Various pages and reports use bar graphs, which technically are tables with certain cells filling in with different colours. Unfortunately, most browsers don't print these bar graphs properly.  See attachment (from Firefox).
fields.summary: Bar graphs (eg. on reports) don't print properly
Stop identical comments being posted

fields.summary: Comments notifications are not sent when a user attaches a file

fields.description:
If the user clicks the Version Control tab before the CVS information was retrieved the thread just hangs until the CVS repository is parsed. If the repository takes a long time to parse or retrieve teh log the UI thread is locked up. Many users just hit refresh and lock up another thread.

This is a huge problems when the CVS server stops responding as the thread takes a long time to time out.

In JIRA 3.4 this is not too bad as there is a timeout on CVS checkout thread. However, the timeout is quite long (10 minutes) so problems still arise.
fields.summary: UI locks up when the CVS repository takes long time to parse or update

fields.description: On the Add Portlet screen, the screenshot for Two Dimensional Filter Statistics is misleading as it is the same screenshot for (one dimensional) Filter Statistics.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics: Wrong Screenshot

fields.description:
Using Windows in other language different from English the list separator not always is "comma".

For example MS-Windows in Spanish language and language "Español (Colombia)" in the regional configuration control panel sets the separator as ";".

I suggest the option to select the separator.
fields.summary: Selectable separator when importing a CSV file

fields.description:
We have just transferred our issue tracking system to Jira, and because it is project based, hundreds of issues that got lost because they were unassigned have appeared. However I now cannot distinguish between issues that were previously lost and need to be dealt with, issues that are assigned to me or my team and need to be dealt with, and issues that are assigned to other departments and can be ignored.

We have a team user account for our team. Ideally we should be having a group, but our Jira admins paid no attention to our processes when setting the Jira system up. Nevertheless, even in the long term it would be useful to be able to filter on issues where the assignee is:

Unassigned OR me OR team mate 1 OR team mate 2 OR ... OR team account

Even if we get a Jira user group set up for our team, it would still be nice to be able to search by Assignee = Unassigned OR team's user group.

I imagine it would also be useful to some people to be able to search for faults assigned to users in one or more of multiple user groups.
fields.summary: Improved assignee searching - multiple assignees

fields.description:
E.g. I want to be able to filter for all open, in progress, or reopened issues in a specific project with summaries that do not contain the phrase ""Merge request".

According to the help files, you can search for entries where the text contains A but not B, but you simply cannot search for entries where the text does not contain B. All text exclusions require a text inclusion term before they work properly.

I find this very limiting and unnecessary.

There are many text search syntaxes, of which the most famous is regexp. Many of them allow such a search. it is sad that the Jira text search capability does not allow this. Perhaps the best solution is to allow regexp searches as an advanced function.
fields.summary: Improved text searches in filters - text exclusion only

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to sort search results by a field that is not actually part of the displayed results.

Say for example I wanted to sort my filter output by the number of votes in order to prioritise issues, but the actual numbers of votes themselves have no real meaning. Due to shortage of screen space I don't want to see the vote count for each issue, but I still do want to sort by it.
fields.summary: Sort filter results by non-visible field

On the "Scheduler details" page, I see no option to start / restart it.....Also, would you have any ideas why it is down: I mean: is it down by default or would we have shut it down one way or another??? I guess that would also explain why our CVS logs are not parsed by JIRA anymore!!! My second question is about the memory: when should we bump from 512MB to something higher? fields.description:
If you have an issue with issue links but you do not have permission to view the issue/s, then a black line appears across the page.

This is because the check to make sure there are no links, does not take into account permissions and security levels.
fields.summary: Line appears across View Issue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8846].
  {panel}

We are looking at instigating a more formal 'new feature' workflow and we were thinking about using subtasks for it. The basic idea is that all new features require that a design document is written and approved, that a test plan is created, that the feature is implemented etc. What we would like to do is whenever an issue of type 'new feature' is created have the standard subtasks automatically added to it.

Currently the only post functions I can add to Create Issue are:
1. Assign to reporter
2. Create comment
3. Update Issue Field

We would like to see "Add sub-task" added to this list. This would let us add each of the sub-tasks to be created, and would save us from having to write custom code.

Even better than this would be to allow this to be defined when creating an issue type. Currently you can specify:

1. Name
2. Description
3. Icon URL

It would be extremely cool to see a list of default subtasks for this issue type.
fields.summary: Support automatic adding of subtasks for particular issue types - add create sub task workflow post function
Should have default read-only workflow scheme

fields.description:
When you login, everything is correctly localized, with one very visible exception : "Browse Projects" in the upper menu bar is still in english.

When you click on "Browse Projects" it gets you to the overview of all projects in jira (which it should do). When you then click on one project ... *click* ... *page load* ... *tadah!* ... the word "Browse Project" is gone and it gets correctly translated as the german word "Projektübersicht". From then on it stays correctly translated during the whole user session. When you logout and login again the problem starts again.

I can reproduce this error on our server and also on jira.atlassian.com
fields.summary: "Browse Project" is NOT TRANSLATED after login, but gets translated, when you navigate into a project

fields.description:
Scenario:

1) Create a new issue
2) Attach a document to the issue
3) Append a text to the Description field - the text shall reference the attachment (as attachment number 1)
4) Add another attachment

Problem:
The attachment that was no. 1 before step 4 has now turned into attachment no. 2. This means that the reference in the Description text has turned erroneous. This seems to me to be an odd way to manage the attachment numbers.

Proposal :
The attachment number shall be unique for a certain attahcment to a certain issue. This means that each time a new attachement is made for an issue, a new attachment number shall be drawn. This also has the consequence, that it is immediately apparent if an attachment is removed, as the corresponding number is missing from the list of attachments (i.e. if no. 1 was deleted from the issue in the above example, no. 2 should remain no. 2 and no. 1 is missing).
fields.summary: Referencing attachments

fields.description:
Hi,

JIRA has been running for a long period and it's great to experience such an uptime. One downside is that the catalina.out file grew to almost 300MB.

How can we configure JIRA's logging system to rotate catalina.out file daily, as is done with other files (e.g. atlassian-jira.2005-12-19.log)

Thanks,
Guillaume.

*Workaround*

Options to rotate catalina.out and detailed steps for using logrotate are documented at [How to Rotate the Catalina Log File|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Rotate+the+Catalina+Log+File]
fields.summary: How to rotate Tomcat's catalina.out

fields.description:
The {{IssueSearch}} object has a {{populateSearchRequest}} method on the interface. However, for people to use this programatically, they have to construct dummy FieldValuesHolder and then pass that to the method.

There should be a convention to make sure all Searchers come with with a method that allows you to add to the SearchRequest relatively simply (already done for QuerySearcher) This will be a great help to plugin developers.
fields.summary: Add a developer friendly populateSearchRequest method to IssueSearchers

fields.description:
Currently Jira assumes that all date fields are date picker fields. The problem is that generally the date-time format is different to the date format, but the csv import does not take this into account and so the following error is thrown.

[16:52:26] FAILED: Customfield value 13-Feb-04 is invalid
[16:52:26] com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException: Invalid date / time format.  Expected dd-MMM-yy hh:mm a
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.converters.DateTimePickerConverter.getTimestamp(DateTimePickerConverter.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.DateTimeCFType.getSingularObjectFromString(DateTimeCFType.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:478)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:86)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.importer.impl.ImporterThread.run(ImporterThread.java:21)

Jira needs to add the time information to the date field string.
fields.summary: CSV Import should handle date time format
Add documentation on Bulk Workflow Transition functionality.
Update Bulk Edit docs to include all possible editable fields (e.g. change reporter).

fields.description: When you run a CSV Import the plugins, like custom fields are not refreshed. As a result, some information does not appear to be updated.

fields.description: There are a few unclosed tags and invalid html in issue_headertable.jsp.
fields.summary: Fix up invalid html in issue_headertable.jsp

fields.description:
Similar to the bulk move or bulk edit I would like the ability to execute a work flow action on a bulk of issues for a particular issue type. 

So during a release to testing cycle we can put all fixed issue to the next state via executing a bulk transaction. Right now to its very painfully laborious by going to each ticket and executing the transaction to put the ticket in the next state.
fields.summary: Would like to execute a work flow action on multiple issues
An issue moved into a project is not seen as a Created Issue in the target project from a notification perspective.

fields.description: I'd like my subtask to , as a default inherit the parent's component.  presently this has to be added in.  alternatively I'd like to be able to assign the component in the subtask add screen under the parent task.
fields.summary: have subtask inherit component of parents

fields.description: It would be nice in to be able to exclude people in the notification system i.e. you have an issue assigned to yourself  and you add a comment.  An e-mail is generated to go to the current assignee.  However as you are already the current assignee you hardly need an e-mail to tell you that you have put in a comment.  So it would be nice to be able to set the notification to Current Assignee unless the current user is the Current Assignee.
fields.summary: E-mail notification scheme improvement
CSV Importer Wizard needs to escape special characters in the Config File

fields.description: Foregive me if I'm missing something, but suppose I would like to look at 20 bugs, and change the priority of 10 of them to any arbitrary priority (that is, not all to the same priority). The bulk change UI forces me to change them all to the same priority. If I could just get the list, then have drop-downs in each row to change the status, then hit Save and change them all, that would be helpful to me.
fields.summary: Would like to change many items differently, quickly
Single Level Group By Report should be able to use built-in filters

fields.description:
We're looking at changing databases over to the new OracleXE 10g. - the free version Oracle recently released.

I'm using the ojdbc14.jar distributed with the database.
I've set field-type-name="oracle10g" in entityengine.xml.
In web.xml, I've set my session timeout value to a high number.
here's my datasource definition from server.xml (actual usernames and passwords changed to protect the innocent):
                     <Resource name="jdbc/JiraDS" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"/>

fields.description:
Jira is the steering wheel by which our project is driven. It is great.

One thing some dilligent people on our team do is include 'steps' to test a feature once its been added to our software.

With some tweaking Jira could be used to 'generate a test plan' much the way it generates release notes for a project's version.

I really believe this would be a *killer feature*. The ability of Jira to 'Generate a test plan' would really ring in everyone's ears.
fields.summary: generate test plan from issues

fields.description:
The documentation (http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.4.2/querysyntax.html?clicked=jirahelp) states:

Note: The NOT operator cannot be used with just one term. For example, the following search will return no results: 
NOT "atlassian jira"

I would like this to not be true.  I have a filter that shows me everything that is open and targeted for a particular release.  I would like to have another filter that shows me everything that is open that isn't targeted for that particular release.
fields.summary: Allow single term NOT operator in query syntax

fields.description:
The following script (with thanks to Claus-Peter Mörchen) allows JIRA to be restarted on bootup in a SuSE 10 Linux system:

{code}
/etc/init.d/jira

----------------------------------------------------------------
#! /bin/sh
#
### BEGIN INIT INFO
# Provides:          JIRA
# Required-Start:    $network $remote_fs
# Required-Stop:     $network $remote_fs
# Default-Start:     3 5
# Default-Stop:      0 1 2 6
# Short-Description: JIRA and Tomcat
# Description:       Jira Bugtracking System and Jakarta Tomcat Java
#       Servlets and JSP server
### END INIT INFO

. /etc/rc.status
rc_reset

# These are the setting of SuSE Java's engine
# Normally you don't have to change these setting if
# you have installed the Java engine with yast
export JRE_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java/jre
export JAVA_ROOT=/usr/lib/jvm/java
export JDK_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java

# These are the settings of the Jira startup program.
# /jira/bin/startup.sh
# You have to change these settings if you have installed
# Jira in a different directory. You will get all information
# by executing /jira/bin/startup.sh
export CATALINA_BASE=/jira
export CATALINA_HOME=/jira
export CATALINA_TMPDIR=/jira/temp
export JRE_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java/jre

case "$1" in

    start)
        echo -n "Starting JIRA:"
        /jira/bin/startup.sh
        rc_status -v
        RETVAL=$?
        echo
        [ $RETVAL = 0 ] && touch /var/lock/subsys/tomcat
        rc_status -v
        ;;

    restart)
          $0 stop
          $0 start
        ;;

    stop)
        echo -n "Stopping JIRA:"
        /jira/bin/shutdown.sh
        RETVAL=$?
        echo
        [ $RETVAL = 0 ] && rm -f /var/lock/subsys/tomcat
        rc_status -v
        ;;
    *)

        echo "Usage: $0 {start|restart|stop}"
        exit 1
        ;;
esac
rc_exit
{code}
fields.summary: Add note to docs on init.d script for starting JIRA on SuSE 10 Linux

fields.description:
When performing a bulk edit, some of the fields could not be edited. The error message said:
NOTE: This field is hidden for the project(s) of the selected issues.
If the error message read instead:
NOTE: This field is hidden for at least 1 issue in at least 1 project for the selected issues.
it would have helped me realize why I was unable to perform a mass edit on all issues.
It isn't true that the field is hidden for the project - just for one of the issue types in the project. That incorrect error message made it difficult for me to troubleshoot my problem.
fields.summary: Improve message on bulk edit

fields.description: Jira needs to have the concept of a Project Team.  Many times, there are actions and permissions that I want to have happen for team members that are different from their "normal" roles.  Essentially, eavery project would have an associated group, say AYZ-Team for project AYZ.  The members of this group would be administered from the project administration screen in addition to the user/group broswers.  In this way, one would only need admin rights to a given project in order to change the team members for that project.  In all other ways, they would just be another group.
fields.summary: Jira needs the concept of a Project Team
